key_channel_insights.line_content: Over half of the itineraries are priced higher than the airline's site, with strong parity near 40%.
Nearly 88% of fares are lower than the airline's site, showing consistent, minimal higher pricing.
Around three-quarters of GDS fares exceed airline pricing, reflecting stable markups week over week.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over half of the analyzed itineraries show higher OTA prices than the airline’s site, with slight growth over the last month.
OTA-lower cases remain below 6% across most categories, indicating minimal discounting in this channel.
Around 40% of fares match the airline website, with only minor weekly or monthly fluctuations.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Unlisted fares dropped from roughly 12.6% a month ago to just 2.2% last week, signaling improved coverage.
Matching fares stayed near 40%, changing only by 1–2% over recent periods.
More than half of sampled itineraries outpriced the airline site, up from about 45% previously.
Below 6% of all observations consistently came in under the airline fare, indicating limited price advantages.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 55% of listings are pricier on OTA, while about 38% align exactly with airline rates, showing steadiness across weeks.
OTA fares exceed carrier pricing 44% of the time, contrasted by 49% parity. Shifts across weeks remain negligible.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA prices ran higher on over 80% of itineraries, dwarfing all other pricing statuses.
Three-quarters of fares match the airline site, with around 24% listed higher and virtually no lower fares.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Half the fares are higher on OTA; roughly 40% match, and 7% are lower, trending slightly upward from last month.
Nearly 59% of flights cost more on OTA, with no lower fares observed, indicating minimal early-booking discounts.

mse_highlights.line_content: Over 87% of itineraries were priced lower on MSE last week, showing a steady upward trend from the previous week.
Only 0.36% of routes had higher fares on MSE, indicating almost no premium over the airline’s own site.
The average last-week price difference across all records was -0.03%, reflecting close alignment with the airline’s website.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No evidence of missing offers on MSE last week, suggesting full product coverage.
Pricing matched in about 12% of cases recently, a slight dip from 16% in the prior week.
Dominant status at nearly 88% last week, climbing by almost four points week over week.
Remains negligible at 0.36% frequency, posing minimal pricing risk.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Channel-lower spiked to nearly 91% last week, up about eight points and sustaining strong competitive advantage.
Channel-lower dropped from 86% to 78% as identical fares rose to 22%, indicating shifting alignment with the website.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Channel-lower remains high at 86% last week, though it declined from 90%, compensating for a slight rise in identical pricing.
Lower fares surged from 78% to 89% last week, largely replacing identical fares.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Channel-lower dominated at 88% last week, a boost of over two points from the prior week.
Lower fares prevailed at 86%, while a small 1.09% were priced higher on MSE.

gds_highlights.line_content: About three-quarters of itineraries remain priced above the website, with little change from last week.
Around 15% of fares match the website, showing stable trends week over week.
Under 10% of itineraries are priced lower in GDS, with a modest uptick versus last week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Minimal instances where no matching website fare was found; remains negligible in the dataset.
Hovers at approximately 15%, with only minor fluctuations from one week to the next.
Represents a small share near 8% but has shown slight positive movement compared to last week.
Continues to be the dominant segment at around 77%, with a marginal dip of less than 1% week on week.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Roughly 88% of short-haul fares are higher on GDS, though slightly down from the prior week.
Around 46% of long-haul itineraries are higher via GDS, up by nearly 1% from last week, with close to half pricing the same as the website.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: GDS fares remain high for 85% of itineraries, down a few percentage points from last week but balanced by a slight increase in GDS-lower cases.
Roughly 69% of fares are higher on GDS, a small improvement, with same fares steady at about a quarter of itineraries.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Over 70% of close-in fares are GDS higher, little changed from last week, while around 12% are GDS lower.
85% of far-out booking fares are higher on GDS, and GDS-lower cases remain at zero for the latest week.
